channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: London's Trendiest Office Space - Lead and Mid-Level Perl Developer roles
item.description: I love working in a vibrant, modern space. If youâ€™re going to spend all day at work, it might as well be somewhere you enjoy being, rather than a cubicle farm. This client has a workspace Iâ€™m actively jealous of!

item.title: Do you love customers? Senior Perl Developer with a product focus, London
item.description: Ever find yourself wishing you could see meaningful impact on users from your work? Trapped in a company with long release cycles and dubious release dates? Wish your ideas for product improvement didnâ€™t keep disappearing in to the Project Managerâ€™s backlog?

item.title: Fancy an all-inclusive trip to The Perl Conference next year*?
item.description: I attend a lot of Perl conferences and itâ€™s always interesting to see which employers are well-represented with a lot of delegates and which employers have little or no presence...

item.title: Hotel rooms and The Perl Conference
item.description: This year TPF ended up having to pay $10k for hotel rooms that weren't taken up for YAPC::NA. Dan explains why, and what is going to change as a result.

item.title: Samantha McVey's grant update 3
item.description: An update from Samantha on her Rakduo unicode grant work.

item.title: Grant approved: revitalize blogs.perl.org
item.description: The grant proposal by André Walker, to sort out blogs.perl.org, has been approved.

item.title: Grant Proposal: Complete YAML::PP
item.description: Tina Müller has requested a grant of $2500 to complete YAML::PP, a new pure perl YAML parser, a key goal for which is support of YAML 1.2. If you've got an opinion, you can share it in the comments.

item.title: Things Thomas Klausner learned at the European Perl Conference 2017
item.description: Thomas shares a list of the things he learned at TPC::iA, and looks forward to Glasgow.

item.title: How to make Perl conferences beginner friendly
item.description: Some of the first-time attendees as TPC::iA thought it wasn't very beginner-friendly. Thomas shares some ideas for addressing that.

item.title: Lance Wicks' report
item.description: Lance's perspective on the conference, with links to slides for the two talks he gave. One of them was on the Pull Request Challenge, so I'm looking forward to the watching the video.

item.title: One person's review of Rakudo
item.description: A long review of Rakudo that tries to give a balanced perspective, after using it for a while, and writing a small library in it. One of his summary lines is that Rakudo "lacks a strong 'hook', and it's also kind of slow", and also "certainly alone in the audacity of its ambitions and sheer complexity of the language".

item.title: EPO's booklet introducing Rakudo
item.description: Mark has been working on a booklet that introduces Rakudo, for distribution both inside and outside the Perl community.

item.title: Moritz's ten years of Rakudo
item.description: Moritz reminisces on his ten years in the Rakudo project.

item.title: Take a walk on the C side, ddt, du du, du du ...
item.description: Nadim shows how Data::Dump::Tree displays the different NativeCall elements.

item.title: 2017.32 Weekly 101
item.description: Liz's weekly roundup of Rakudo news, the 101st of these.

item.title: Deprecation warnings now tell you when the features will disappear
item.description: Apparently Abigail shared this tidbit in a lightning talk, and brian is sharing it a bit more widely: Perl 5 deprecations will start saying when the feature will become fatal, as of Perl 5.28.

item.title: Fixing a bug in HTTP::XSCookies - dealing with XS crashes
item.description: Colin describes how the team at CV Library tracked down, and fixed, a bug in an XS module.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: July 10th-16th
item.description: The weekly summary of news from P5P, mainly a list of new issues, and issues that have been resolved.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Ask not what CPAN can do for you
item.description: CPAN Day is August 16th. If you can't think of something to do on that day, why not help us fix up distributions that don't have either of META.yml or META.json.

item.title: #316 - Winter, er CPAN Day, is coming!
item.description:
The European Perl Conference has finished, and it looks to have been a good 'un. You can watch videos of some of the talks, and more will eventually become available.

Wednesday is CPAN Day, so why not do something to give back to our crown jewel?

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
